question: What is "Estonian Carry"?
option1: An ancient equipment to transport ice berg from one place to another.
option2: An annual ritual to commemorate Russian invasion of Estonia.
option3: A technique used to participate in a contest in which a male competitors race while each carrying a female teammate.
option4: A special fish harvesting festival in the Baltic Sea coast of Estonia.
answer: A technique used to participate in a contest in which a male competitors race while each carrying a female teammate.
explanation: Estonian carry is a technique that is used in a wife-carrying contest in which male competitors race while each carrying a female teammate. Estonians are so adept at the non-Olympic sport of wife-carrying. Estonian couples won the wife-carrying world championships for two consecutive years between 1998 and 2008.
